alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 10:46AM EST until January 04 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion Greenville County in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Rivers continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1042 AM EST, Flooding along the Reedy River and Brushy Creek will linger into this afternoon. Please also be wary of developing flooding along the Enoree and possibly Gilder Creek as well. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Welcome, Donaldson Center, Cherrydale Point, GSP Airport, Paris Mountain State Park and Fork Shoals. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
